Fans are eager to learn Mario Lopez’s net worth in 2025 and how he has accumulated his wealth throughout his career. Over the years, he has not only made his mark as an accomplished and versatile actor but, has also established himself as a beloved TV host.

So, here is everything to know about Lopez’s current net worth and the sources of his income.

What is Mario Lopez’s net worth in 2025?

Mario Lopez has an estimated net worth of $35 Million in 2025.

Lopez’s net worth in 2025 consists of earnings from his career as a television host and actor.

Mario Lopez is most famous for playing the role of A.C. Slater in the popular sitcom, Saved by the Bell. He has also appeared in other series in the franchise, including Saved by the Bell: The College Years, as well as the 2020 eponymous revival series. Additionally, Lopez has appeared as a host on Access Hollywood since 2019.

What does Mario Lopez do for a living?

Mario Lopez is an actor, television host, author, and band manager.

Most recently, Lopez hosted the 2024 game show television series, Blank Slate. The format of the show features pairs of contestants teaming up with a guest comedian each. Together, they must match their answers to fill-in-the-blank questions in order to win the game and the prize money.

Mario Lopez’s earnings explained — how does he make money?

Mario Lopez earns money from his career as a television host and actor. Additionally, his book ventures, his work as a band manager, and his real estate investments have also contributed to his net worth.

Acting

Mario Lopez began his career in the 80s and has appeared in a slew of popular movies and television series over the years. These include Eastside, King Rikki, Saved by the Bell, Pacific Blue, and more. In 2018, he also made his Broadway debut in the revival of the musical, A Chorus Line.

TV Host

Mario Lopez has hosted numerous notable television shows and events including Access Hollywood, The X Factor Season 2, MTV’s Top Pop Group, America’s Best Dance Crew, and Miss Universe 2020, to name only a few.

Writing

Besides his career as a performer, Lopez has also forayed into authoring books. The three non-fiction books he has published are Mario Lopez Knockout Fitness, Extra Lean, and Mario and Baby Gia. Extra Lean also went on to become a New York Times bestseller in 2010.

Band Manager

Mario Lopez has been involved in reviving the popular Puerto Rican boy band, Menudo, and helped them hold auditions for new members as an interim manager. In 2023, the band released their first single, “Mi Amore,” under his mentorship. The following year, Menudo also competed in America’s Got Talent.

Real Estate Ventures

Mario Lopez has also dabbled in several real estate investments in California over the years. In 2022, he sold his two Burbank homes, receiving over $1 million for each property. The same year, the actor also listed his Spanish-style Glendale home for sale for $6.5 million.

In addition, Lopez made it a rental property for $25,000 monthly, eventually selling it for $4.33 million in 2023. Meanwhile, he purchased a 9,000-square-foot mansion in Los Angeles’ La Cañada Flintridge suburb for $9.4 million.
